articles.description: Hosts India reach the semi-finals of the Cricket World Cup by thrashing Sri Lanka by 302 runs in Mumbai.
articles.title: Sri Lanka bowled out for 55 as India reach semis

articles.description: Luis Manuel Díaz was seized by armed men at a petrol station on Saturday in his Colombian hometown.
articles.title: Footballer Díaz's father 'kidnapped by rebels'

articles.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag has vowed to fight on after seeing his side thrashed by Newcastle in the EFL Cup fourth round.
articles.title: Ten Hag vows to 'fight on' - but 'questions' grow for Man Utd boss

articles.description: Fernando Alonso makes it clear he is annoyed with claims that he could switch to Red Bull from Aston Martin and says there will be "consequences".
articles.title: Alonso annoyed with rumours of move to Red Bull

articles.description: Joe Root says he would still choose England's XI over Australia's "every day" despite their struggles at the World Cup in India.
articles.title: I'd pick England's XI over Australia every day - Root

articles.description: Watch highlights as India dismiss Sri Lanka for just 55 to secure a World Cup semi-final spot in Mumbai.
articles.title: Superb India bowl out Sri Lanka for 55 to win by 302 runs

articles.description: Jon Rahm withdraws from the inaugural season of the new golf venture launched by Tiger Woods and Rory McIlroy.
articles.title: Rahm pulls out of Woods and McIlroy's golf venture

articles.description: England captain Marlie Packer and wing Abby Dow have been nominated for World Rugby's women's player of the year.
articles.title: Packer & Dow nominated for world player of the year

articles.description: England's Wayne Barnes announces his retirement from refereeing following his appearance in last Saturday's Rugby World Cup final.
articles.title: World Cup final referee Barnes announces retirement

articles.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on singer-songwriter & Chelsea fan Willie J Healey in this weekend's Premier League predictions.
articles.title: Sutton's Premier League predictions v singer Willie J Healey
